title: Ticket #2368: [RFE] add support for condor_suspend && condor_continue
description:
Add support to be able to condor_suspend && condor_continue a series of jobs.

This would override the STARTD(s) SUSPEND && CONTINUE.

The route of communication follows the condor_vacate path:

client->schedd->shadow->startd->starter on update

starter->shadow->schedd.

Motivation: The ability to determine shared resource utilization based on job, user, or constraint.

2011-Aug-29 14:53:02 by psilord:
Ok, I did the review:

General questions:

What's the motivation for this work? [See Above]

Why is it necessary? [==Motivation]

Who wanted it? [Can't state, but numerous condor-users have desired]

Please write into the main body of the ticket the answers to these questions.

What happens if you upgrade condor, have a job as recorded in suspended state in the queue, shut off condor, downgrade it, then start up the old one? Will the schedd start at all?

Unknown, it would likely not be good b/c we added a state ~= Transfer mod

Does condor_suspend and condor_continue take the same kind of arguments like condor_rm--meaning a user name, a jobid, or a constraint?

Yes, and this requires documentation

Can you suspend or continue jobs from a machines point of view?

That's what SUSPEND and CONTINUE expressions are for ;-) + there is the default constraint you can pass

Now that job suspend/continue events are synched to the schedd, what is the expected performance impact for reasonable policies? Are the suspend events fsynced()--they shouldn't be.

It has to update the job state which I believe translates to a durable transaction == fsync

It used to be that you only paid for the suspend queue connections from the shadow to the schedd when you asked for it, and now you always pay with no way to stop it. In pools with heavy churn of suspending jobs (which may actually exist today, since we don't keep good stats) there is no recourse for a pool admin to deal with it.

Honestly, if this is the case you would want it to be denoted properly, as it stands now (prior to patch) it's obscured, but the admin "should deal with it"

What does a pool admin do if their suspend policies start causing the shadows to time out talking to the schedd and killing their jobs so they must rerun?

That is no different then what an admin would have to do today

Put braces around all single statement blocks for if statements. It prevents merge accidents later.
